BR_text.BRsummary: accuracy of cpp example is a constant value when training, no matter how many epochs trained!
BR_text.BRdescription:
cpp example : lenet_with_mxdataiter(gpu and cpu)  mlp_cpu mlp_gpu
 I've tested examples on three PCs (win8.1 64bit && win2012 64bit && centos7 64bit ) ,
 roughly it's same, just mlp_gpu works correctly.
 <denchmark-h:h2>Environment info  Operating System && Compiler</denchmark-h>
 
 win8.1 64bit && win2012 64bit  ===>  vs2017 cmake
 centos7 64bit                              ===>  gcc
 Package used:                                          cpp
 MXNet version:      installed from source
 MXNet commit hash (git rev-parse HEAD):
 SHA-1: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/commit/6d7157768e216bcb4b505f98555fc72286d160fb>6d71577</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>Error Message:</denchmark-h>
 
 accuracy is a constant value , no matter how many epochs trained
 please refer to attached images.
 <denchmark-h:h2>Minimum reproducible example</denchmark-h>
 
 no modification just run after compiled
 <denchmark-h:h2>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
 
 no modification just run after compilederror.
 <denchmark-h:h2>What have you tried to solve it?</denchmark-h>
 
 run example on other PCs
